intro: Impatiens duthieae, commonly known as Duthie's impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and grows as an upright herbaceous perennial. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
